image.altText: A man in hi vis stands in front of a stack of timber

props.synopsis: The government has struck a deal with the Greens to overhaul Australia environmental laws, sparking concerns for the future of Tasmania's native logging industry.

title.children: Sawmiller 'worried' as Labor, Greens strike deal over environment laws

image.altText: He wears a suit and stands by the theatre

props.synopsis: Launceston City Council recently received backlash over its redevelopment of Albert Hall. A councillor now warns another project will cost more than planned, as he calls out a culture of "secrecy".

title.children: Councillor warns another Tasmanian project on track for cost blowout

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff with a football.

props.synopsis: With the vote to decide the fate of the Hobart stadium a week away, Premier Jeremy Rockliff's political legacy is in the balance.

title.children: The way Rockliff will be remembered inextricably tied to Hobart stadium's future

image.altText: A close up photo of two 3d printed guns, photo supplied by Tasmania Police.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police say they have discovered 3D printers, several 3D-printed firearms and silencers, cash and a quantity of methylamphetamine during three searches.

title.children: 3D-printed firearms, cash, drugs, silencers seized during Tasmanian raids

image.altText: Tasmanian Treasurer Eric Abetz gestures with his hands.

props.synopsis: A major credit rating agency has downgraded Tasmania's credit rating, a move described by a prominent economist as a "vote of no confidence" in the government's fiscal strategy, but brushed off by the treasurer who says he is "not alarmed".

title.children: Moody's downgrades Tasmania's credit rating to lowest of all Australian states

image.altText: Four buildings burn at night in a city against a smoke-filled orange sky

props.synopsis: At least 44 people are dead and others remain missing after a massive fire that engulfed multiple high-rise towers at a residential complex in Hong Kong. Follow live.

title.children: 'Gross negligence' caused deadly Hong Kong high-rise fires, police say

image.altText: Beach signage with police tape across pathway

props.synopsis: One woman is dead and a man is in a critical condition after a shark attack at Crowdy Bay on the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: 'Courage from bystanders' praised after woman killed in shark attack

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: The banking regulator will impose restrictions on home loans from early next year to limit the number of "high-risk" large loans being issued to customers, which could have flow on effects in the housing market.

title.children: Banking regulator APRA to impose home loan caps amid housing boom

image.altText: National guard soldiers stand together behind yellow tape at a crime scene.

props.synopsis: The two US National Guard soldiers who were shot in Washington were among more than 2,000 troops deployed to the US capital.

title.children: Trump sent soldiers to Washington to reduce crime. Now two are fighting for life

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: An eight-year-old boy has been treated for non-life-threatening injuries after a reported stabbing at a school in Melbourne's south-east on Thursday morning, police say.

title.children: Eight-year-old boy injured in reported stabbing at Melbourne school

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking, seen from lower down. The man is surrounded by microphones.

props.synopsis: What does a dead cat have to do with Donald Trump and the Epstein files? Everything, according to some experts.

title.children: The 'dead cat' theory could apply to Donald Trump and the Epstein files

image.altText: Outside the ACT Fire and Rescue South Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The baby — estimated to be less than 24 hours old — was found this morning outside a fire station.

title.children: Police concerned for mother after newborn baby found outside fire station

image.altText: A generic photo of two teenage schoolkids sitting side by side, using their phones.

props.synopsis: The platforms, which can be used to make real people appear nude in photos and videos, have been used in several high-profile cases in Australian schools.

title.children: 'Nudify' services used by Australian school students blocked

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Police say a search of an area of state park near Ballarat for missing woman Samantha Murphy may continue beyond Thursday.

title.children: State park search for Samantha Murphy could continue beyond Thursday

image.altText: murder victim Lilie James in a car wearing a yellow top smiles as she takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A NSW coroner has urged young people to consider their use of location-sharing technology after the "senseless" murder of Lilie James at the hands of her ex-boyfriend.

title.children: Coroner releases findings into murder of Lilie James at Sydney school

image.altText: Harvey Milk

props.synopsis: Harvey Milk had been elected to the San Francisco Board of Supervisors in 1977 — a little over a year later, he would be dead.

title.children: Before his assassination, California's first openly gay official taped his last words

image.altText: NASA's Perseverance Mars rover taking a selfie.

props.synopsis: Microphone recordings from NASA's Perseverance rover have turned up more than 50 instances of lightning on the red planet over the past four years, a new study finds.

title.children: Sound of lightning captured on Mars — but it's nothing like on Earth

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian banking regulator will impose limits on large home loans from February, while the ASX rises as Wall Street extended a recent recovery. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX rises, APRA to impose home loan limits

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: China Vanke bonds extend losses after developer seeks its first onshore repayment delay
New capital expenditure rises 6.4 per cent

image.altText: Jeremy smiling at camera in black shirt

props.synopsis: Jeremy Webb died aged 16 after eating sausages while camping in the Central Coast. Growing up, he was bitten by ticks outdoors multiple times.

title.children: Teen's death from suspected meat allergy caused by ticks could be a 'first'

image.altText: the silouhette of a young woman sititng on a bed

props.synopsis: Suicide Prevention Australia says there's an "urgent" need for action to stop the "significant and lasting" impact of childhood trauma.

title.children: The 'concerning' link between childhood maltreatment and suicide risk

image.altText: Ben Stokes walks off as Australian players celebrate

props.synopsis: Suggestions the pitch at Perth Stadium was not up to scratch for the first Ashes Test have been well and truly put to bed as the ICC hands down its assessment of the playing surface.

title.children: Spotlight on England's poor batting as ICC rates Perth pitch 'very good'

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera while holding a mobile phone up.

props.synopsis: Optus has been under intense scrutiny after a network outage in September left hundreds of people unable to call Triple Zero and was linked to three deaths.

title.children: 'Nightmare' complaint left Optus customer and offshore worker in tears

image.altText: A man and a woman stand with giant puppets of characters Bluey and Bingo.

props.synopsis: A deal between the federal government and the minor party will see an extra $50 million go to the public broadcaster to facilitate passage of a bill to impose local content requirements on streaming platforms.

title.children: Labor and Greens agree on extra ABC funding for kids' programs

image.altText: A woman hugs her father as they reunite surrounded by flood waters

props.synopsis: The Thai city of Hat Yai received its heaviest rainfall in 300 years, while mudslides killed dozens on the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

title.children: Floods leave at least 50 dead across Thailand, Indonesia and Malaysia

image.altText: A man wearing a hard hat.

props.synopsis: The operators of Ballarat Gold Mine have been charged over a rockfall that killed 37-year-old miner Kurt Hourigan and seriously injured a 21-year-old workmate in March 2024.

title.children: Ballarat mine operators charged over fatal rockfall

image.altText: Green chardonnay grapes sit on vines in bunches.

props.synopsis: The wine grape industry has written to the SA government pleading for help as it reaches breaking point after indicative pricing for the next vintage is released showing growers could face losses of up to $270 per tonne.

title.children: White wine grape growers already in crisis suffer 'another kick in the guts'

image.altText: Photos of an e-bike, some delivery food e-bikes, in the Parramatta CBD on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Bicycle industry figures welcome planned changes by the federal government, but hope state governments will update road rules to help enforcement.

title.children: The rule change that could stop 'overpowered' e-bikes being brought into Australia

image.altText: Sad woman holding frame of child's photo with bear toy on lap.

props.synopsis: Kloe Weedon's son Zeke William Hondow, a schoolboy with a sharp wit and even sharper haircuts, was farewelled at a funeral last week.

title.children: Her 8yo son was killed in an e-motorbike crash. Now Kloe Weedon wants new rules to protect kids

image.altText: Three SES personnel at a house assessing storm damage.

props.synopsis: Thousands of residents in Western Sydney are waking up without power and some schools across NSW will be closed after a freak storm on Wednesday.

title.children: Thousands still without power, schools closed after freak storm

image.altText: Advertisements for Black Friday sales are seen online on a mobile phone screen

props.synopsis: With millions of Australians tipped to spend record amounts this Black Friday, the value of personal credit and charge-card balances accruing interest has hit its highest level since 2021.

title.children: Black Friday sales 'pressure' pushing some Australians into debt binge

image.altText: A woman next to a pink wall

props.synopsis: Queensland's transport department has threatened to penalise residents who set up street-side charity cupboards without filling in the requisite paperwork.

title.children: Government threatens to shut down 'illegal' street charity

image.altText: Jai Opetaia holds his belts

props.synopsis: Jai Opetaia's next opponent, Germany's Huseyin Cinkara, believes he has the power it takes to defeat the Australian world cruiserweight champion when they meet in the Gold Coast.

title.children: Fiery German threatens to 'knock Opetaia senseless' in title fight

image.altText: Usman Khawaja pictured in Australia's Test kit

props.synopsis: Matt Renshaw is gunning for a spot in Australia's Test side, but does not want it to come at the expense of Australia's veteran opener Usman Khawaja just yet.

title.children: Contender for Khawaja's Test spot calls him one of Australia's best ever

image.altText: Graphic depicts Darren Lockyer and Ryan Reynolds with rugby league players and the text 'welcome to London'

props.synopsis: The London Broncos might be the only rugby league club in Britain to have experienced relegation before a season even began — and Darren Lockyer, through the help of PNG Players, is hoping to bring them back.

title.children: 'Welcome to London': Darren Lockyer channels Ryan Reynolds in new plan
